pesticide.PPE: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants; Chemical-resistant gloves: barrier laminate, butyl rubber ≥14 mils, neoprene rubber ≥14 mils, nitrile rubber ≥14 mils, polyvinyl chloride (PVC) ≥14 mils, or Viton™ ≥14 mils; Shoes plus socks

Safety_Information.general_Info: Harmful if swallowed or absorbed through skin. Avoid contact with skin, eyes or clothing. Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling and before eating, drinking, chewing gum, using tobacco or using the toilet. Remove and wash contaminated clothing before reuse.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have a person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Have the product container or label with you when calling a poison control center or doctor, or going for treatment.

Application_Info.application_Method: Water-based slurry through standard slurry seed treatment equipment

Target_Disease_Pest.name: Seed rot/pre-emergence damping-off, post-emergence damping-off, and seedling blight caused by Fusarium, Pythium, and Rhizoctonia species
Seedling root rot caused by Fusarium species
Seed rot and seedling blight caused by seed-borne Phomopsis species
Early-season root rot caused by Phytophthora species
